libraryEntries.title: Acacia
libraryEntries.summary: A protective plant used to ward off evil and stimulate the psychic mind.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn the wood with sandalwood as incense.

libraryEntries.title: Agrimony
libraryEntries.summary: Protects against goblins and evil, and is used to reverse hexes and send them back to the caster.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Sprinkle around the area to banish negative energies.

libraryEntries.title: Alfalfa
libraryEntries.summary: Kept in the home to protect against poverty and hunger, and used in money spells.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn and scatter the ashes around the property.

libraryEntries.title: Allspice
libraryEntries.summary: Used to attract money and luck, as well as to promote healing.

libraryEntries.title: Almond
libraryEntries.summary: Brings success in business ventures, money, and grants the partaker wisdom.
libraryEntries.careNote: Bitter almond is not for internal use due to cyanogenic glycosides.

libraryEntries.title: Aloe
libraryEntries.summary: Guards against evil influences and prevents household accidents when grown in the home.

libraryEntries.title: Althea
libraryEntries.summary: A good 'spirit-puller' that brings good spirits in during rituals when placed on the altar.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn as incense or carry in a sachet.

libraryEntries.title: Amaranth
libraryEntries.summary: A crown of amaranth flowers worn on the head speeds healing and protects.

libraryEntries.title: Angelica
libraryEntries.summary: Used to remove curses, hexes, and spells that have been cast against you.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Add to bath water or sprinkle around the perimeter of the house.

libraryEntries.title: Anise
libraryEntries.summary: Placed in a pillowcase to prevent nightmares and placed around the magic circle to ward off evil.

libraryEntries.title: Apple
libraryEntries.summary: A fruit heavily associated with love spells, immortality, and Samhain rituals.
libraryEntries.careNote: Seeds are poisonous in large amounts.

libraryEntries.title: Asafoetida
libraryEntries.summary: Destroys manifestations of spirits if thrown onto a fire or censer during magical rites.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn small amounts in exorcism and protection incenses.

libraryEntries.title: Ash
libraryEntries.summary: A staff of ash wards off malign influences, and its leaves induce prophetic dreams.

libraryEntries.title: Basil
libraryEntries.summary: Soothes tempers between lovers and brings wealth to those who carry it.
libraryEntries.careNote: Not safe for infants and toddlers in large quantities.

libraryEntries.title: Bay
libraryEntries.summary: Induces prophetic dreams, offers protection against poltergeists, and grants physical strength.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Protection, Psychic Powers, Healing, Purification, Strength
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burned or scattered during exorcism rituals.

libraryEntries.title: Belladonna
libraryEntries.summary: Once used to encourage astral projection and produce visions, but generally avoided today.
libraryEntries.careNote: Extremely poisonous; all parts can be fatal.

libraryEntries.title: Benzoin
libraryEntries.summary: Used to clear out negative energy and attract prosperity to a business or home.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn as an incense to purify.

libraryEntries.title: Wood Betony
libraryEntries.summary: Protects against nightmares and helps reunite quarreling couples when added to food.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Scatter around doors and windows to form a protective wall.

libraryEntries.title: Birch
libraryEntries.summary: A purificatory herb used to exorcise spirits and protect against the evil eye and lightning.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Gently strike possessed people or animals with birch twigs.

libraryEntries.title: Blackberry
libraryEntries.summary: Used for magical healing by crawling through its natural arches, and wards off evil spirits.

libraryEntries.title: Bloodroot
libraryEntries.summary: Carried or worn to draw love, avert evil spells, and protect the home.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Cast a circle of powdered root around the home.

libraryEntries.title: Borage
libraryEntries.summary: Carried to strengthen courage, protect outdoors, and induce psychic powers.

libraryEntries.title: Broom
libraryEntries.summary: Hung in the home to keep evil out and used in spells to raise winds.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Sprinkle the infusion through the house to exorcise poltergeists.

libraryEntries.title: Burdock
libraryEntries.summary: Used to ward off negativity and to heal conditions like gout.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Cast around the home to ward off negativity.

libraryEntries.title: Caraway
libraryEntries.summary: Prevents theft, protects children from illness, and incites lust.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Protection, Lust, Health, Anti-theft, Mental Powers

libraryEntries.title: Carnation
libraryEntries.summary: Gives strength and energy to a healing patient and offers protection.

libraryEntries.title: Catnip
libraryEntries.summary: Creates a psychic bond with cats, attracts good spirits, and forms lasting friendships.

libraryEntries.title: Cedar
libraryEntries.summary: Protects against lightning, draws money, and heals head colds through purification.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Smoulder twigs or burn as incense to purify.

libraryEntries.title: Roman Chamomile
libraryEntries.summary: Used to attract money, induce sleep, and remove curses cast against you.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Sprinkle around property to remove curses.

libraryEntries.title: Cherry
libraryEntries.summary: Used to attract or stimulate love and to divine the number of years left in one's life.
libraryEntries.careNote: Seed and wilted leaf are poisonous.

libraryEntries.title: Cinnamon
libraryEntries.summary: Raises high spiritual vibrations, draws money, stimulates psychic powers, and offers protection.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Spirituality, Success, Healing, Power, Psychic Powers, Lust, Protection, Love

libraryEntries.title: Cinquefoil
libraryEntries.summary: Grants eloquence when asking for favors and ensures restful sleep when placed under the bed.

libraryEntries.title: Clove
libraryEntries.summary: Attracts riches, stops gossip, and drives away hostile or negative forces.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn as an incense to purify an area.

libraryEntries.title: Clover
libraryEntries.summary: Different leaves bring different powers: two for love, three for protection, four for magic, five for money.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Protection, Money, Love, Fidelity, Exorcism, Success
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Sprinkle red clover infusion to remove negative spirits.

libraryEntries.title: Comfrey
libraryEntries.summary: Protects travelers and safeguards luggage from being lost or stolen.

libraryEntries.title: Coriander
libraryEntries.summary: Added to love sachets and warm wine for lust, and worn to ease headaches.

libraryEntries.title: Corn
libraryEntries.summary: A symbol of plenty and fertility, used to bless areas and used in divination.

libraryEntries.title: Cypress
libraryEntries.summary: Eases the mind and allays grief during times of crisis and death.

libraryEntries.title: Daffodil
libraryEntries.summary: Attracts love and good luck, and increases fertility when placed in the bedroom.

libraryEntries.title: Daisy
libraryEntries.summary: A flower of coquetry that brings love and can return an absent lover if slept upon.

libraryEntries.title: Dandelion
libraryEntries.summary: Divines lifespan and is used to send messages of love upon the wind.

libraryEntries.title: Dill
libraryEntries.summary: Protects homes from envious individuals, draws money, and stimulates lust.

libraryEntries.title: Dragon's Blood
libraryEntries.summary: A potent resin burned to entice errant lovers to return and to cure impotency.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burned to clear spaces and protect.

libraryEntries.title: Elder
libraryEntries.summary: Wards off attackers and evil magic, and forces witches to release enchantments.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Scatter leaves and berries to bless a person, place, or thing.
libraryEntries.careNote: All parts except the ripe fruit are poisonous.

libraryEntries.title: Eucalyptus
libraryEntries.summary: Stuffs healing poppets and maintains good health when worn or placed beneath the bed.
libraryEntries.careNote: Do not use on the faces of small children.

libraryEntries.title: Eyebright
libraryEntries.summary: Clears the mind, aids memory, and induces magical clairvoyance.

libraryEntries.title: Fennel
libraryEntries.summary: Guards against evil spirits, prevents tick bites, and is used in purificatory sachets.

libraryEntries.title: Lavender
libraryEntries.summary: Attracts men, induces peaceful sleep, and guards against cruelty and depression.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Love, Protection, Sleep, Chastity, Longevity, Purification, Happiness, Peace
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn to purify or add to purification baths.

libraryEntries.title: Rosemary
libraryEntries.summary: Ensures good sleep, prevents nightmares, preserves youthfulness, and aids memory.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Protection, Love, Lust, Mental Powers, Exorcism, Purification, Healing, Sleep, Youth
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Smoulder to rid a place of negativity, especially prior to performing magic.

libraryEntries.title: Sage
libraryEntries.summary: Ensures a long life, promotes wisdom, and is heavily utilized in healing spells.

libraryEntries.title: Adder's Tongue
libraryEntries.summary: Used primarily in healing magic to cure wounds or bruises by applying it soaked in cold water.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Wrap in cloth, apply to wound until warm, then bury in a muddy place.

libraryEntries.title: African Violet
libraryEntries.summary: Grown in the home to promote spirituality and provide a slightly protective energy.

libraryEntries.title: Agaric
libraryEntries.summary: Used to encourage fertility by being placed on the altar or in the bedroom.
libraryEntries.careNote: Poisonous (Death Angel/Death Cap). Do not consume.

libraryEntries.title: Anemone
libraryEntries.summary: Red blossoms are used in healing rituals and carried to prevent disease.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Wrap the fresh blossoms in a red cloth and wear or carry.

libraryEntries.title: Apricot
libraryEntries.summary: The fruit and leaves are utilized in spells and potions to attract love.

libraryEntries.title: Arabic Gum
libraryEntries.summary: Burned as an incense to purify an area of negativity and evil.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Smoulder alone on charcoal or add to purification incenses.

libraryEntries.title: Arbutus
libraryEntries.summary: Protects little children and is used in exorcisms to chase away evil entities.

libraryEntries.title: Aster
libraryEntries.summary: Used in love sachets or grown in the garden with a wish to attract love.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Carry the bloom to win love.

libraryEntries.title: Avens
libraryEntries.summary: Used in exorcisms, purification rites, and as an amulet against venomous beasts.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Sprinkle around the area to be exorcised.

libraryEntries.title: Avocado
libraryEntries.summary: Carried to promote beauty, while the seed is grown or carried to attract love.

libraryEntries.title: Bachelor's Buttons
libraryEntries.summary: Worn on the breast or kept in the pocket to attract the love of a man.

libraryEntries.title: Lemon Balm
libraryEntries.summary: Soaked in wine or carried to influence and attract love, and used in healing.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Soak the herb in wine for several hours, strain, and share with a friend.

libraryEntries.title: Balm of Gilead
libraryEntries.summary: Used to mend a broken heart, attract a new love, and burned to manifest spirits.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn as a material basis for spirits.
libraryEntries.careNote: Ensure you have the correct botanical species.

libraryEntries.title: Barley
libraryEntries.summary: Used in love spells and scattered on the ground to keep evil and negativity away.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Scatter on the ground to ward off evil.

libraryEntries.title: Fragrant Bedstraw
libraryEntries.summary: Worn or carried in magical applications to attract love.

libraryEntries.title: Beet
libraryEntries.summary: Beet juice is used as a magical ink in love magic or as a blood substitute.
libraryEntries.careNote: Large amounts of the leaf can be harmful.

libraryEntries.title: Orange Bergamot
libraryEntries.summary: Slipped into wallets and purses to attract money and success.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Rub fresh leaves onto money before spending it to ensure its return.

libraryEntries.title: Bistort
libraryEntries.summary: Carried in sachets to attract wealth and burned to drive out poltergeists.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Place under the pillow for prophetic dreams.

libraryEntries.title: Bittersweet
libraryEntries.summary: Placed beneath the pillow to forget past loves, or worn to heal and protect.

libraryEntries.title: Bladderwrack
libraryEntries.summary: A seaweed used in sea spells, wind spells, and to attract money or psychic powers.
libraryEntries.spiritualProperties: Protection, Sea Spells, Wind Spells, Money, Psychic Powers

libraryEntries.title: Bleeding Heart
libraryEntries.summary: Used in love spells or grown to attract love into one's life.

libraryEntries.title: Boneset
libraryEntries.summary: Used to ward off evil spirits and heavily utilized in exorcisms.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Make an infusion and sprinkle about the house to drive away evil.

libraryEntries.title: Bracken
libraryEntries.summary: Burned outside to bring rain, or placed beneath the pillow for prophetic dreams.
libraryEntries.careNote: Can be poisonous in large amounts.

libraryEntries.title: Brazil Nut
libraryEntries.summary: Carried as a talisman to bring good luck in love affairs.

libraryEntries.title: Briony
libraryEntries.summary: Used as a substitute for mandrake in money and protection spells.

libraryEntries.title: Bromeliad
libraryEntries.summary: Grown in the home to attract luxury, money, and provide protection.

libraryEntries.title: Buchu
libraryEntries.summary: Drunk as an infusion to foretell the future or burned to produce prophetic dreams.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn a small amount with frankincense in the bedroom.

libraryEntries.title: Buckthorn
libraryEntries.summary: Placed near doors or windows to drive away enchantments, sorceries, and evil.
libraryEntries.careNote: R. frangula bark must be aged two years prior to internal use.

libraryEntries.title: Buckwheat
libraryEntries.summary: Scattered around the house to keep evil out and used in money incenses.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Use the seeds to form magic circles on the floor.

libraryEntries.title: Cabbage
libraryEntries.summary: Planted in the garden right after marriage to ensure good luck for a couple.

libraryEntries.title: Cactus
libraryEntries.summary: Protective plants grown indoors or outdoors to banish negative energies and prevent burglaries.

libraryEntries.title: Calamus
libraryEntries.summary: Strung as beads for healing or kept in kitchen corners to protect against poverty.
libraryEntries.careNote: Some species are dangerous; avoid taking internally.

libraryEntries.title: Camellia
libraryEntries.summary: Placed in vessels of water on the altar to bring riches and luxury.

libraryEntries.title: Camphor
libraryEntries.summary: Smelled to lessen sexual desire, or placed by the bed to prevent colds.

libraryEntries.title: Caper
libraryEntries.summary: Eaten to cure impotency and used in love and lust formulas.

libraryEntries.title: Carrot
libraryEntries.summary: The seeds are eaten to help women become pregnant and to promote lust.

libraryEntries.title: Cashew
libraryEntries.summary: Used in magical spells to attract money and prosperity.

libraryEntries.title: Castor
libraryEntries.summary: Used to absorb disease and protect against the evil eye.

libraryEntries.title: Cat Tail
libraryEntries.summary: Carried by women who dislike sex to help arouse sexual desire.

libraryEntries.title: Celandine
libraryEntries.summary: Aids in escaping unwarranted entrapments and imparts good spirits to cure depression.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Wear next to the skin and replace every three days.

libraryEntries.title: Celery
libraryEntries.summary: Seeds are chewed for concentration or burned with orris root to increase psychic powers.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn with orris root to increase psychic powers.

libraryEntries.title: Centaury
libraryEntries.summary: The smoke from burning this herb is traditionally used to drive off snakes.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Burn or fume to drive off snakes.

libraryEntries.title: German Chamomile
libraryEntries.summary: Used in calming and sleep incenses, and to combat curses and spells.

libraryEntries.title: Chestnut
libraryEntries.summary: Used in love spells and fed to a loved one to encourage affection.

libraryEntries.title: Chickweed
libraryEntries.summary: Carried or used in spells designed to attract a love or maintain a relationship.

libraryEntries.title: Chicory
libraryEntries.summary: Used to remove obstacles and obtain favors from great persons.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Anoint your body with chicory juice.

libraryEntries.title: Chili Pepper
libraryEntries.summary: Used to ensure a mate's fidelity or to break curses and hexes.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Cross two peppers, tie with a red ribbon, and place beneath the pillow.

libraryEntries.title: Chrysanthemum
libraryEntries.summary: Protects against the wrath of gods, guards gardens from evil, and cures drunkenness.

libraryEntries.title: Citron
libraryEntries.summary: Eaten to increase psychic powers and used in healing spells.

libraryEntries.title: Club Moss
libraryEntries.summary: Carried for protection and to receive blessings from the Gods.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Take a purification bath before uprooting the plant with a silver blade.

libraryEntries.title: Cimaruta
libraryEntries.summary: An intricate traditional Italian amulet usually crafted from silver or silver-colored metal to repel the Evil Eye.
libraryEntries.careNote: Can be attached to red ribbons or hands of bananas for maximum effect.

libraryEntries.title: Hamsa (Hand of Fatima)
libraryEntries.summary: A metal depiction of a hand placed in windows or over doors to repel malice and negative enchantment.
libraryEntries.careNote: Combine with an old metal key and a head of garlic for superior home protection.

libraryEntries.title: Blue Eye Bead (Nazar Boncuk)
libraryEntries.summary: Round blue glass beads that use dizzying colors to dazzle and repel the Evil Eye.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Cleanse, charge, and consecrate them before use and whenever they have successfully 'worked' for you.
libraryEntries.careNote: Can be worn singly, pinned to clothing, or strung together to form horseshoes.

libraryEntries.title: Metal Key
libraryEntries.summary: Old iron or metal keys are used to symbolically lock up a target or protect the home from malicious forces.
libraryEntries.cleansingMethod: Heat until red-hot on an anvil for specific ritual preparations.
libraryEntries.careNote: In binding spells, the key must be turned a quarter-turn daily to maintain the 'lock'.

libraryEntries.title: Coffin Nail
libraryEntries.summary: A highly specific iron nail utilized in binding and punitive hexes to fulfill a life sentence against a target.
libraryEntries.careNote: Use a rusty nail as a substitute if a coffin nail is unavailable.

libraryEntries.title: Sieve
libraryEntries.summary: A mesh strainer used in divination spells alongside molten wax or tin to identify the perpetrator of bewitchment.

libraryEntries.title: Beeswax
libraryEntries.summary: Melted wax carefully poured into cold water to form shapes that are analyzed for divination (ceromancy).
libraryEntries.careNote: Requires a white cloth and a dish of ice water for traditional group ceromancy.

libraryEntries.title: Red Wine
libraryEntries.summary: Used as a potent offering to powerful spirits like Oya, or as a base to steep magical botanicals.

libraryEntries.title: Dark Rum
libraryEntries.summary: A strong alcoholic offering favored by gatekeeper spirits such as Papa Legba and Exu Marabo.
libraryEntries.careNote: Feed rum to concrete Elegba heads every Monday to ensure continued protection.

libraryEntries.title: Honey
libraryEntries.summary: The physical embodiment of sweet water spirits like Oshun; used to sweeten targets or draw love.
libraryEntries.careNote: Always taste the honey before offering it to Oshun to prove it is not poisoned.

libraryEntries.title: Milk
libraryEntries.summary: Used in luxurious ritual baths for prosperity, or soaked into bread as a healing offering for Babalu-Aye.
libraryEntries.careNote: A magical bath combines cow's, goat's, sheep's, and coconut milk in equal proportions.

libraryEntries.title: Colored Ribbons
libraryEntries.summary: Tied around amulets, poppets, or botanicals to seal magic, with specific colors directing the energy.
libraryEntries.careNote: Nine distinct colors are used for Oya's hurricane cleansing spells.

libraryEntries.title: Magical Cord (Thread)
libraryEntries.summary: Lengths of yarn or thread used to physically insert intent, blessings, or restrictions through knot magic.
libraryEntries.careNote: Yucca thread is specifically recommended for stringing protective ghost beads.

libraryEntries.title: Cowrie Shell
libraryEntries.summary: Embedded into concrete fetishes to form the eyes and ears of spirits, or added to fertility bags.

libraryEntries.title: Bamboo Flute
libraryEntries.summary: A Feng Shui cure placed lengthwise beneath a mattress to magically alleviate back problems.
libraryEntries.careNote: Position between the box spring and the mattress.

libraryEntries.title: Iron Pot
libraryEntries.summary: A traditional vessel used to boil spell ingredients, brew potions, or process ritual waters.

libraryEntries.title: Iron Anvil
libraryEntries.summary: A heavy iron block used by smiths, utilized magically to heat spell keys until they are red-hot.
libraryEntries.careNote: A cast-iron pan can substitute if an anvil is unavailable.

libraryEntries.title: Armenian Bole
libraryEntries.summary: An earthy clay historically prescribed to wealthy patients and used in the magical Hungary Powder.
libraryEntries.careNote: Used to relieve smallpox and measles in traditional magical compounds.

libraryEntries.title: Terra Lemnia
libraryEntries.summary: A sacred earth from the island of Lemnos, used alongside Armenian bole in miracle healing powders.

libraryEntries.title: Hartshorn
libraryEntries.summary: Powdered animal horn included as a vital ingredient in expensive, historical healing amulets.

libraryEntries.title: Ivory Raspings
libraryEntries.summary: Scraped ivory dust combined with precious gems and earths to form Hungary Powder.

libraryEntries.title: Gold Leaf
libraryEntries.summary: Edible or cosmetic flakes of gold mixed into potions and powders to instill solar healing vitality.

libraryEntries.title: Sheep's Shoulder Blade
libraryEntries.summary: A cleaned bone pierced with seven silver needles to aggressively summon djinn from the earth.
libraryEntries.careNote: Left at ruins or crossroads to await the spirit's response.

libraryEntries.title: Snake-skin
libraryEntries.summary: A freely shed skin utilized to wrap roots and charms to create the equivalent of a magical doctor's bag.
libraryEntries.careNote: Must be shed naturally by the snake to be magically effective.

libraryEntries.title: Spirit Money (Hell Bank Notes)
libraryEntries.summary: Paper currency burned in massive quantities to honor and appease Chinese spirits and deities.
libraryEntries.careNote: Required as an offering to convince disease spirits to leave.

libraryEntries.title: Lye
libraryEntries.summary: A highly caustic substance combined with red brick dust to violently scrub away intense hexes.
libraryEntries.careNote: Extremely dangerous; handle with strict physical safety precautions.

libraryEntries.title: Urine
libraryEntries.summary: A bodily fluid used in aggressive protective washes to reverse crossed conditions and dominate enemies.
libraryEntries.careNote: Typically diluted in water for scrubbing floors.

libraryEntries.title: Ammonia
libraryEntries.summary: Poured over an enemy's name inside a bowl to keep them locked up or spiritually restricted.
libraryEntries.careNote: Ensure proper ventilation when using this pungent liquid indoors.

libraryEntries.title: Turpentine
libraryEntries.summary: Its harsh fumes are utilized to banish torturous demonic visions and severe nightmares.
libraryEntries.careNote: Not safe for consumption. Do not use around children or animals.

libraryEntries.title: Magic Sword
libraryEntries.summary: A bladed weapon used ritually to demarcate boundaries and defy lurking spirits during childbirth.
libraryEntries.careNote: Recognized by spiritual forces as an impenetrable barrier.

libraryEntries.title: Ritual Knife (Athame)
libraryEntries.summary: Employed to cast invisible magic circles or silently harvest herbs without alarming their spirits.
libraryEntries.careNote: Gold blades are historically preferred for harvesting certain sensitive roots.

libraryEntries.title: Ritual Fan
libraryEntries.summary: A tool used to direct energy and demarcate a circle in space when drawing protective boundaries.

libraryEntries.title: Staff
libraryEntries.summary: A large wooden tool used to physically ground energy, ward off malign influences, and set magical borders.

libraryEntries.title: Horseshoe
libraryEntries.summary: An iron charm historically hung to draw luck, or constructed entirely out of blue glass beads to repel the Evil Eye.
libraryEntries.careNote: Magnetic variations are placed in spell bags for financial goals.

libraryEntries.title: Silver Sixpence (Coins)
libraryEntries.summary: Specific silver coins collected secretly from bachelors and forged into a ring to cure seizure disorders.
libraryEntries.careNote: The individuals donating the coins must not know their magical purpose.

libraryEntries.title: Magic Ring
libraryEntries.summary: Jewelry enchanted to bestow intense seductive powers or to continually transmit healing energy.
libraryEntries.careNote: Must be forged by a bachelor smith if used for European healing spells.

libraryEntries.title: Baby Shoes
libraryEntries.summary: Brought as an offering to fertility shrines, or taken home from a shrine to act as a powerful conception amulet.
libraryEntries.careNote: If conception is successful, a replacement pair must be donated back.

libraryEntries.title: Altar Candle
libraryEntries.summary: Typically white, these candles are used universally in uncrossing rituals and to light the sacred space.

libraryEntries.title: Figure Candle
libraryEntries.summary: Candles shaped like men, women, or conjoined couples used to represent the specific targets of a spell.
libraryEntries.careNote: Divorce candles feature the couple standing back to back.

libraryEntries.title: Devil Candle
libraryEntries.summary: A candle carved as an entity, burned in green for fast cash, red for sex, or black for intense domination.
libraryEntries.careNote: Often engraved with the sigils of specific spirits before burning.

libraryEntries.title: Dice
libraryEntries.summary: Tossed in divination, with specific rolls (like sixes) invoking Turanna, the Italian Venus, for luck in romance.

libraryEntries.title: Tarot Cards
libraryEntries.summary: Used to scry the future, or placed directly under a pillow to incubate and manifest a highly specific dream.
libraryEntries.careNote: Use the exact same cards nightly until the issue resolves.

libraryEntries.title: Divination Arrow
libraryEntries.summary: Arrows marked with affirmative, negative, or blank messages cast to receive immediate answers to fate.
libraryEntries.careNote: The blank arrow is necessary as some fates cannot be revealed.

libraryEntries.title: Ambergris
libraryEntries.summary: A highly prized waxy substance originating from whales, historically added to oils to magnetically attract men.

libraryEntries.title: Civet
libraryEntries.summary: A pungent animal glandular secretion utilized in premium magical oils to magnetically attract women.

libraryEntries.title: Musk
libraryEntries.summary: An animal secretion incorporated into formulas designed to stimulate raw courage, deep fertility, and lust.

libraryEntries.title: Dragon's Blood
libraryEntries.summary: A vibrant red resin burned to banish negative forces and blended into oils to heal lovers' quarrels.

libraryEntries.title: Frankincense
libraryEntries.summary: A sacred ancient resin smoldered on charcoal to purify spaces, exorcise evil, and summon angelic hosts.

libraryEntries.title: Myrrh
libraryEntries.summary: Burned alone or with frankincense to stimulate erotic dreams, provide deep healing, and break powerful hexes.

libraryEntries.title: Tragacanth Gum
libraryEntries.summary: Used magically for binding spells and to safely bridge the ethereal world into the subconscious dream state.
libraryEntries.careNote: Often blended with elemental symbols to fill dream pillows.
